snapshot_1.name: Taketei
snapshot_1.description: Taman Desa's latest spot for Japanese soul food mainly tackles ramen - the Jiro Ramen (RM16.

snapshot_2.name: Hermanos Rotisserie
snapshot_2.description: A mural of the historical evolution of spit-roasting illustrates the highlight of Hermanos, billed as the ‘chicken shop’ of Shah Alam.

snapshot_3.name: Flower Girl Coffee
snapshot_3.description: Springtime has come for restaurant enthusiasts at Sunway Geo Avenue, where many new eateries have sprouted recently.

snapshot_4.name: Siu G Jai
snapshot_4.description: Siu yuk satay is the novelty here - skewers of crunchy, meaty roast pork, complemented by a spicy peanut dipping sauce, onions and cucumbers.

snapshot_5.name: Roshona Bilash
snapshot_5.description: Bangladeshi cooking secures a boost at Roshona Bilash, thronged mainly by migrant workers in a testament to the authenticity of its fare.

snapshot_6.name: Lily's Homemade
snapshot_6.description: Fans of chunky sausages might want to check out Lily's Homemade, which prides itself primarily on products independently made with premium pork, free of nasty chemicals, growth hormones and antibiotics.
